ai.summary: Felbrigg Circular is a demanding 20.3 km loop in the UK, combining rural lanes, woodland paths and open countryside. The route is rated hard and suits experienced hikers with good fitness. Expect varied scenery and a substantial day on the trail.
ai.terrain_summary: Undulating rural tracks, woodland paths and field margins with uneven footing. Expect a mix of grassy, gravel and muddy sections, stiles and gates, and several short steep ascents and descents. Weather can alter footing, so waterproof gear is essential.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a long day (roughly 5-7 hours depending on pace). Check the forecast and daylight hours, as this is a rural UK route with potential limited mobile signal. Carry a map and compass or offline navigation, tell someone your route and expected finish time, and bring a charged phone, water, food, a first aid kit and suitable clothing. Wear sturdy boots, watch for mud, and be prepared for sudden weather changes.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or offline GPS
Fully charged phone and power bank
Headlamp or flashlight (in case of late finish)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn for best daylight and trail conditions; winter hiking is possible with full waterproofing and extra caution for ice and mud.

seo.title: Felbrigg Circular: 20.3 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the Felbrigg Circular, a challenging 20.3 km hike in the UK. Read about terrain, safety, best seasons, and gear for this demanding circuit.
